ResourceHeader.ResourceName: THEMIS-A: ESA electron/ion energy fluxes and moments

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata
Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, metadata versioned up to SPASE 2.6.0, reviewed by LFB 20230727

Updated PublishedBy name to match ROR Registry. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: THEMIS-A: Electrostatic Analyzers (ESA): Electron/Ion Ground-Calculated Energy Fluxes (5eV - 25 keV for Ions and 6eV - 30 KeV for Electrons) and Moments (density, velocity, pressure, and temperature). The satellite has 2 modes Fast and Slow survey and 3 data types: FULL, REDUCED and BURST. FULL: 88 angles x 32 energies, time resolution of 128 spins(395 seconds) in slow survey and 32 spins(98 seconds) in fast survey. REDUCED: spin time resolution(3 sec) but angles averaged into 1 angular spectra x 32 energies in slow survey or 6 angular spectra(90 degree x 90 degree window) x 32 energies in fast survey. BURST: 88 angles x 32 energies and spin time resolution(3 sec) but only available sporadically and for short duration. Note that angular resolution affects moments since they are obtained integrating over the mode-specific angular distribution. These moments are processed on the ground. They should be regarded as approximations but will improve in quality as our processing routines are improved over the course of the mission to account for additional sources of variance.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA contract NAS5-02099 and V. Angelopoulos for use of data from the THEMIS Mission. Specifically: C. W. Carlson and J. P. McFadden for use of ESA data.

PublicationInfo.Authors: Angelopoulos, Vassilis; Carlson, Charles, W.; McFadden, James, P.

Rights.Note: CC0 1.0 Universal is the Creative Commons license applicable to all publicly available NASA Heliophysics data products

AccessURL.Name: FTPS from SPDF (not with most browsers)
AccessURL.Description: NASA/GSFC CDAWeb ftp access to the data.

AccessURL.Name: HTTPS from SPDF
AccessURL.Description: In CDF via HTTP from SPDF

AccessURL.Name: CDAWeb
AccessURL.Description: Access to ASCII, CDF, and plots via NASA/GSFC CDAWeb

Rights.Note: CC0 1.0 Universal is the Creative Commons license applicable to all publicly available NASA Heliophysics data products

AccessURL.Name: CDAWeb HAPI Server
AccessURL.Description: Web Service to this product using the HAPI interface.

NumericalData.Caveats: EFI booms for THEMIS A(P5) were deployed on 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT. Before this time the spacecraft potential was not calculated accurately. Electron moments will not be distributed prior to this date and ion moments will less accurate. See THEMIS website for caveats(http://themis.ssl.berkeley.edu)

Parameter.Name: ESA Full Mode, Ion Density
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion Density from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: ESA Ion Average Temperature: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion Average Temperature from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: ESA Ion Thermal Velocity: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion Thermal Velocity from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: SC Potential at full distribution cadence
Parameter.Description: The Spacecraft Potential that was used for calculating the moments that were generated from the full angle distribution. This parameter was taken from the EFI data and interpolated to the cadence of the ESA full distribution data.
Parameter.Caveats: This spacecraft potential parameter is the current best estimate of the spacecraft potential, estimates will improve as the mission continues. EFI booms for THEMIS A(P5) were deployed on 2008-01-14/17:00:00. Before this time this spacecraft potential was not calculated accurately. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: ESA Ion energy spectrogram: full distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion energy spectrogram energy flux calculated from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Energy levels of eflux bins are stored in tha_peif_en_eflux_yaxis. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: tha_peif_en_eflux_yaxis: full distribution
Parameter.Description: Energy level of energy bins for tha_peif_en_eflux
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: tha_peif_t3
Parameter.Description: Ion temperature eigenvalues of the diagonalized pressure tensor calculated from the full angle distribution. Includes two perpendicular elements and one parallel element. (Tprp1_ion, Tprp2_ion, Tpar_ion)
Parameter.Caveats: The first eigenvalue and eigenvector are the distinguisheable eigenvalue and the major (symmetry) axis, respectively. .The "degenerate" eigenvalues are sorted such that the 2nd eigenvalue is smaller than the third one. Coordinate system is ostensibly magnetic field aligned but may deviate if the particle distribution is strongly isotropic. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: tha_peif_magt3
Parameter.Description: Temperature eigenvalues of the diagonalized pressure tensor corrected to align with magnetic field using FGM data. Calculated from full angle distribution. Includes two perpendicular elements and one parallel element. (Tprp1_ion, Tprp2_ion, Tpar_ion)
Parameter.Caveats: 3d temperatures around magnetic axis (Z) and normal axes (X,Y), where Y is Z direction crosed into Sun direction, and X completes orthogonal system. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure Tensor: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion pressure tensor calculated from full angle distribution. Elements from symmetric ion pressure covariance matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Only 6 elements are provided since matrix is symmetrical. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Ion Momentum Flux Tensor: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Momentum Flux Tensor calculated from full angle distribution. Elements from symmetric ion momentum flux matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Ion Particle Flux Vector: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Particle Flux Vector calculated from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Ion Symmetry Vector: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Symmetry Vector is the direction of pressure tensor(peif_ptens) symmetry in despun spacecraft coordinates. This parameter is calculated from the full angle distibution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: This is the direction vector of the principal axis of the pressure tensor in despun spacecraft coordinates. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Ion Symmetry Angle (between symmetry direction and B): Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Symmetry Angle between symmetry direction and B. Can also be treated as the angle between the z axes of the peif_t3 and the peif_magt3 quantities. Calculated from the full angle distribution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Vector SC: Full Distribution/Ion
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field Vector in despun spacecraft coordinates. This quantity was the quantity used to calculate the full distribution moments. It was taken from the FGM data and interpolated to match the cadence of the full distribution ESA data.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Ion Velocity Vector SC: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Velocity Vector in Despun spacecraft coordinates. Calculated from full distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Ion Velocity Vector in GSE: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Velocity Vector in GSE coordinates. Calculated from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Ion Velocity Vector in GSM: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Velocity Vector in GSM coordinates. Calculated from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: tha_peif_time
Parameter.Description: tha_peif_time, UTC, in seconds since 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00; marks center time of data sample. These are used as the sample times for the ESA full distribution data
Parameter.Caveats: Unleaped seconds. Sample start and end time can be calculated from tha_peif_delta_time (sample duration). Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: tha_peif_delta_time
Parameter.Description: Duration in seconds of sample. In otherwords cadence of the full distribution samples.

Parameter.Name: tha_peif_mode
Parameter.Description: Ion survey mode, controls angle and energy binning, and time resolution, values of 0 to 8
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: tha_peif_epoch0
Parameter.Description: EPOCH of THEMIS time base

Parameter.Name: ESA Full Mode, Electron Density
Parameter.Description: ESA Electron Density from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: ESA Electron Average Temperature: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Electron Average Temperature from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: ESA Electron Thermal Velocity: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Electron Thermal Velocity from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: SC Potential at full distribution cadence
Parameter.Description: The Spacecraft Potential that was used for calculating the moments that were generated from the full angle distribution. This parameter was taken from the efi data and interpolated to the cadence of the esa full distribution data.
Parameter.Caveats: This spacecraft potential parameter is the current best estimate of the spacecraft potential, estimates will improve as the mission continues. EFI booms for THEMIS A(P5) were deployed on 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT. Before this time this spacecraft potential was not to calculated accurately and will not be available. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: ESA Electron energy spectrogram: full distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Electron energy spectrogram energy flux calculated from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Energy levels of eflux bins are stored in tha_peef_en_eflux_yaxis. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: tha_peef_en_eflux_yaxis: full distribution
Parameter.Description: Energy level of energy bins for tha_peef_en_eflux
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Electron Diagonalized Temperature
Parameter.Description: Electron temperature eigenvalues of the diagonalized pressure tensor calculated from the full angle distribution. Includes two perpendicular elements and one parallel element. (Tprp1_elec, Tprp2_elec, Tpar_elec)
Parameter.Caveats: The first eigenvalue and eigenvector are the distinguisheable eigenvalue and the major (symmetry) axis, respectively. .The "degenerate" eigenvalues are sorted such that the 2nd eigenvalue is smaller than the third one. Coordinate system is ostensibly magnetic field aligned but may deviate if the particle distribution is strongly isotropic. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Diagonalized Temperature, Field Aligned
Parameter.Description: Temperature eigenvalues of the diagonalized pressure tensor corrected to align with magnetic field using FGM data. Calculated from full angle distribution. Includes two perpendicular elements and one parallel element. (Tprp1_elec, Tprp2_elec, Tpar_elec)
Parameter.Caveats: 3d temperatures around magnetic axis (Z) and normal axes (X,Y), where Y is Z direction crosed into Sun direction, and X completes orthogonal system. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Pressure Tensor: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron pressure tensor calculated from full angle distribution. Elements from symmetric electron pressure covariance matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Only 6 elements are provided since matrix is symmetrical. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Momentum Flux Tensor: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Momentum Flux Tensor calculated from full angle distribution. Elements from symmetric electron momentum flux matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Particle Flux Vector: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Particle Flux Vector calculated from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Symmetry Vector: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Symmetry Vector is the direction of pressure tensor(peef_ptens) symmetry in despun spacecraft coordinates. This parameter is calculated from the full angle distibution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: This is the direction vector of the principal axis of the pressure tensor in despun spacecraft coordinates. Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Symmetry Angle (between symmetry direction and B): Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Symmetry Angle between symmetry direction and B. Can also be treated as the angle between the z axes of the peef_t3 and the peef_magt3 quantities. Calculated from the full angle distribution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Vector SC: Full Distribution/Electron
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field Vector in despun spacecraft coordinates. This quantity was the quantity used to calculate the full distribution moments. It was taken from the FGM data and interpolated to match the cadence of the full distribution ESA data.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Vector SC: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Velocity Vector in Despun spacecraft coordinates. Calculated from full distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Vector in GSE: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Velocity Vector in GSE coordinates. Calculated from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Vector in GSM: Full Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Velocity Vector in GSM coordinates. Calculated from full angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: tha_peef_time
Parameter.Description: tha_peef_time, UTC, in seconds since 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00; marks center time of data sample. These are used as the sample times for the ESA full distribution data
Parameter.Caveats: Unleaped seconds. Sample start and end time can be calculated from tha_peef_delta_time (sample duration). Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: tha_peef_delta_time
Parameter.Description: Duration in seconds of sample. In otherwords cadence of the full distribution samples.

Parameter.Name: tha_peef_mode
Parameter.Description: Electron survey mode, controls angle and energy binning, and time resolution, values of 0 to 8
Parameter.Caveats: Some of the data are at a cadence of 395 seconds, cadences switch due to mode changes on the probe.

Parameter.Name: tha_peef_epoch0
Parameter.Description: EPOCH of THEMIS time base

Parameter.Name: ESA Reduced Mode, Ion Density
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion Density from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: ESA Ion Average Temperature: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion Average Temperature from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: ESA Ion Thermal Velocity: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion Thermal Velocity from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: SC Potential at reduced distribution cadence
Parameter.Description: The Spacecraft Potential that was used for calculating the moments that were generated from the reduced angle distribution. This parameter was taken from the efi data and interpolated to the cadence of the esa reduced distribution data.
Parameter.Caveats: This spacecraft potential parameter is the current best estimate of the spacecraft potential, estimates will improve as the mission continues. EFI booms for THEMIS A(P5) were deployed on 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT. Before this time this spacecraft potential was not to calculated accurately. Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: ESA Ion energy spectrogram: reduced distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion energy spectrogram energy flux calculated from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Energy levels of eflux bins are stored in tha_peir_en_eflux_yaxis. Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: tha_peir_en_eflux_yaxis: reduced distribution
Parameter.Description: Energy level of energy bins for tha_peir_en_eflux
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Ion Diagonalized Temperature: reduced angle distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion temperature eigenvalues of the diagonalized pressure tensor calculated from the reduced angle distribution. Includes two perpendicular elements and one parallel element. (Tprp1_ion, Tprp2_ion, Tpar_ion)
Parameter.Caveats: The first eigenvalue and eigenvector are the distinguisheable eigenvalue and the major (symmetry) axis, respectively. .The "degenerate" eigenvalues are sorted such that the 2nd eigenvalue is smaller than the third one. Coordinate system is ostensibly magnetic field aligned but may deviate if the particle distribution is strongly isotropic. Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Ion Diagonalized Temperature, Field Aligned: reduced angle distribution
Parameter.Description: Temperature eigenvalues of the diagonalized pressure tensor corrected to align with magnetic field using FGM data. Calculated from reduced angle distribution. Includes two perpendicular elements and one parallel element. (Tprp1_ion, Tprp2_ion, Tpar_ion)
Parameter.Caveats: 3d temperatures around magnetic axis (Z) and normal axes (X,Y), where Y is Z direction crosed into Sun direction, and X completes orthogonal system. Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure Tensor: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion pressure tensor calculated from reduced angle distribution. Elements from symmetric ion pressure covariance matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Only 6 elements are provided since matrix is symmetrical. Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Ion Momentum Flux Tensor: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Momentum Flux Tensor calculated from reduced angle distribution. Elements from symmetric ion momentum flux matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Ion Particle Flux Vector: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Particle Flux Vector calculated from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Ion Symmetry Vector: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Symmetry Vector is the direction of pressure tensor(peir_ptens) symmetry in despun spacecraft coordinates. This parameter is calculated from the reduced angle distibution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: This is the direction vector of the principal axis of the pressure tensor in despun spacecraft coordinates. Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Ion Symmetry Angle (between symmetry direction and B): Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Symmetry Angle between symmetry direction and B. Can also be treated as the angle between the z axes of the peir_t3 and the peir_magt3 quantities. Calculated from the reduced angle distribution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Vector SC: Reduced Distribution/Ion
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field Vector in despun spacecraft coordinates. This quantity was the quantity used to calculate the reduced distribution moments. It was taken from the FGM data and interpolated to match the cadence of the reduced distribution ESA data.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Ion Velocity Vector SC: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Velocity Vector in Despun spacecraft coordinates. Calculated from reduced distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Ion Velocity Vector in GSE: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Velocity Vector in GSE coordinates. Calculated from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Ion Velocity Vector in GSM: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Velocity Vector in GSM coordinates. Calculated from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: tha_peir_time
Parameter.Description: tha_peir_time, UTC, in seconds since 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00; marks center time of data sample. These are used as the sample times for the ESA reduced distribution data
Parameter.Caveats: Unleaped seconds. Sample start and end time can be calculated from tha_peir_delta_time (sample duration). Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: tha_peir_delta_time
Parameter.Description: Duration in seconds of sample. In otherwords cadence of the reduced distribution samples.

Parameter.Name: tha_peir_mode
Parameter.Description: Ion survey mode, controls angle and energy binning, and time resolution, values of 0 to 8
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: tha_peir_epoch0
Parameter.Description: EPOCH of THEMIS time base

Parameter.Name: ESA Reduced Mode, Electron Density
Parameter.Description: ESA Electron Density from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Description: ESA Electron Average Temperature from reduced angle distribution.

Parameter.Name: Electron Pressure Tensor: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron pressure tensor calculated from reduced angle distribution. Elements from symmetric electron pressure covariance matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Only 6 elements are provided since matrix is symmetrical. Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Momentum Flux Tensor: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Momentum Flux Tensor calculated from reduced angle distribution. Elements from symmetric electron momentum flux matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Particle Flux Vector: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Particle Flux Vector calculated from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Symmetry Vector: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Symmetry Vector is the direction of pressure tensor(peer_ptens) symmetry in despun spacecraft coordinates. This parameter is calculated from the reduced angle distibution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: This is the direction vector of the principal axis of the pressure tensor in despun spacecraft coordinates. Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Symmetry Angle (between symmetry direction and B): Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Symmetry Angle between symmetry direction and B. Can also be treated as the angle between the z axes of the peer_t3 and the peer_magt3 quantities. Calculated from the reduced angle distribution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Vector SC: Reduced Distribution/Electron
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field Vector in despun spacecraft coordinates. This quantity was the quantity used to calculate the reduced distribution moments. It was taken from the FGM data and interpolated to match the cadence of the reduced distribution ESA data.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Vector SC: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Velocity Vector in Despun spacecraft coordinates. Calculated from reduced distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Vector in GSE: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Velocity Vector in GSE coordinates. Calculated from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Vector in GSM: Reduced Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Velocity Vector in GSM coordinates. Calculated from reduced angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: tha_peer_time
Parameter.Description: tha_peer_time, UTC, in seconds since 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00; marks center time of data sample. These are used as the sample times for the ESA reduced distribution data
Parameter.Caveats: Unleaped seconds. Sample start and end time can be calculated from tha_peer_delta_time (sample duration). Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: tha_peer_delta_time
Parameter.Description: Duration in seconds of sample. In otherwords cadence of the reduced distribution samples.

Parameter.Name: tha_peer_mode
Parameter.Description: Electron survey mode, controls angle and energy binning, and time resolution, values of 0 to 8
Parameter.Caveats: Data are produced from distributions that are reduced by averaging over angles. In slow survey mode a single angular bin is used. In fast survey six 90 degree by 90 degree bins are used.

Parameter.Name: tha_peer_epoch0
Parameter.Description: EPOCH of THEMIS time base

Parameter.Name: ESA Burst Mode, Ion Density
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion Density from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: ESA Ion Average Temperature: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion Average Temperature from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: ESA Ion Thermal Velocity: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion Thermal Velocity from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: SC Potential at burst distribution cadence
Parameter.Description: The Spacecraft Potential that was used for calculating the moments that were generated from the burst angle distribution. This parameter was taken from the efi data and interpolated to the cadence of the esa burst distribution data.
Parameter.Caveats: This spacecraft potential parameter is the current best estimate of the spacecraft potential, estimates will improve as the mission continues. EFI booms for THEMIS A(P5) were deployed on 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT. Before this time this spacecraft potential was not to calculated accurately. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: ESA Ion energy spectrogram: burst distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Ion energy spectrogram energy flux calculated from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Energy levels of eflux bins are stored in tha_peib_en_eflux_yaxis. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: tha_peib_en_eflux_yaxis: burst distribution
Parameter.Description: Energy level of energy bins for tha_peib_en_eflux
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Ion Diagonalized Temperature: burst angle distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion temperature eigenvalues of the diagonalized pressure tensor calculated from the burst angle distribution. Includes two perpendicular elements and one parallel element. (Tprp1_ion, Tprp2_ion, Tpar_ion)
Parameter.Caveats: The first eigenvalue and eigenvector are the distinguisheable eigenvalue and the major (symmetry) axis, respectively. .The "degenerate" eigenvalues are sorted such that the 2nd eigenvalue is smaller than the third one. Coordinate system is ostensibly magnetic field aligned but may deviate if the particle distribution is strongly isotropic. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Ion Diagonalized Temperature, Field Aligned: burst angle distribution
Parameter.Description: Temperature eigenvalues of the diagonalized pressure tensor corrected to align with magnetic field using FGM data. Calculated from burst angle distribution. Includes two perpendicular elements and one parallel element. (Tprp1_ion, Tprp2_ion, Tpar_ion)
Parameter.Caveats: 3d temperatures around magnetic axis (Z) and normal axes (X,Y), where Y is Z direction crosed into Sun direction, and X completes orthogonal system. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure Tensor: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion pressure tensor calculated from burst angle distribution. Elements from symmetric ion pressure covariance matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Only 6 elements are provided since matrix is symmetrical. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Ion Momentum Flux Tensor: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Momentum Flux Tensor calculated from burst angle distribution. Elements from symmetric ion momentum flux matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Ion Particle Flux Vector: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Particle Flux Vector calculated from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Ion Symmetry Vector: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Symmetry Vector is the direction of pressure tensor(peib_ptens) symmetry in despun spacecraft coordinates. This parameter is calculated from the burst angle distibution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: This is the direction vector of the principal axis of the pressure tensor in despun spacecraft coordinates. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Ion Symmetry Angle (between symmetry direction and B): Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Symmetry Angle between symmetry direction and B. Can also be treated as the angle between the z axes of the peib_t3 and the peib_magt3 quantities. Calculated from the burst angle distribution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Vector SC: Burst Distribution/Ion
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field Vector in despun spacecraft coordinates. This quantity was the quantity used to calculate the burst distribution moments. It was taken from the FGM data and interpolated to match the cadence of the burst distribution ESA data.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Ion Velocity Vector SC: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Velocity Vector in Despun spacecraft coordinates. Calculated from burst distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Ion Velocity Vector in GSE: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Velocity Vector in GSE coordinates. Calculated from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Ion Velocity Vector in GSM: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Ion Velocity Vector in GSM coordinates. Calculated from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: tha_peib_time
Parameter.Description: tha_peib_time, UTC, in seconds since 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00; marks center time of data sample. These are used as the sample times for the ESA burst distribution data
Parameter.Caveats: Unleaped seconds. Sample start and end time can be calculated from tha_peib_delta_time (sample duration). Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: tha_peib_delta_time
Parameter.Description: Duration in seconds of sample. In otherwords cadence of the burst distribution samples.

Parameter.Name: tha_peib_mode
Parameter.Description: Ion survey mode, controls angle and energy binning, and time resolution, values of 0 to 8
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: tha_peib_epoch0
Parameter.Description: EPOCH of THEMIS time base

Parameter.Name: ESA Burst Mode, Electron Density
Parameter.Description: ESA Electron Density from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: ESA Electron Average Temperature: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Electron Average Temperature from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: ESA Electron Thermal Velocity: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Electron Thermal Velocity from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: SC Potential at burst distribution cadence
Parameter.Description: The Spacecraft Potential that was used for calculating the moments that were generated from the burst angle distribution. This parameter was taken from the efi data and interpolated to the cadence of the esa burst distribution data.
Parameter.Caveats: This spacecraft potential parameter is the current best estimate of the spacecraft potential, estimates will improve as the mission continues. EFI booms for THEMIS A(P5) were deployed on 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT. Before this time this spacecraft potential was not to calculated accurately and will not be available. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: ESA Electron energy spectrogram: burst distribution
Parameter.Description: ESA Electron energy spectrogram energy flux calculated from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Energy levels of eflux bins are stored in tha_peeb_en_eflux_yaxis. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: tha_peeb_en_eflux_yaxis: burst distribution
Parameter.Description: Energy level of energy bins for tha_peeb_en_eflux
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Electron Diagonalized Temperature: burst angle distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron temperature eigenvalues of the diagonalized pressure tensor calculated from the burst angle distribution. Includes two perpendicular elements and one parallel element. (Tprp1_elec, Tprp2_elec, Tpar_elec)
Parameter.Caveats: The first eigenvalue and eigenvector are the distinguisheable eigenvalue and the major (symmetry) axis, respectively. .The "degenerate" eigenvalues are sorted such that the 2nd eigenvalue is smaller than the third one. Coordinate system is ostensibly magnetic field aligned but may deviate if the particle distribution is strongly isotropic. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Diagonalized Temperature, Field Aligned: burst angle distribution
Parameter.Description: Temperature eigenvalues of the diagonalized pressure tensor corrected to align with magnetic field using FGM data. Calculated from burst angle distribution. Includes two perpendicular elements and one parallel element. (Tprp1_elec, Tprp2_elec, Tpar_elec)
Parameter.Caveats: 3d temperatures around magnetic axis (Z) and normal axes (X,Y), where Y is Z direction crosed into Sun direction, and X completes orthogonal system. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Pressure Tensor: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron pressure tensor calculated from burst angle distribution. Elements from symmetric electron pressure covariance matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Only 6 elements are provided since matrix is symmetrical. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Momentum Flux Tensor: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Momentum Flux Tensor calculated from burst angle distribution. Elements from symmetric electron momentum flux matrix.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Particle Flux Vector: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Particle Flux Vector calculated from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Symmetry Vector: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Symmetry Vector is the direction of pressure tensor(peeb_ptens) symmetry in despun spacecraft coordinates. This parameter is calculated from the burst angle distibution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: This is the direction vector of the principal axis of the pressure tensor in despun spacecraft coordinates. Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Symmetry Angle (between symmetry direction and B): Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Symmetry Angle between symmetry direction and B. Can also be treated as the angle between the z axes of the peeb_t3 and the peeb_magt3 quantities. Calculated from the burst angle distribution quantities.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Vector SC: Burst Distribution/Electron
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field Vector in despun spacecraft coordinates. This quantity was the quantity used to calculate the burst distribution moments. It was taken from the FGM data and interpolated to match the cadence of the burst distribution ESA data.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Vector SC: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Velocity Vector in Despun spacecraft coordinates. Calculated from burst distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: Electron Velocity Vector in GSE: Burst Distribution
Parameter.Description: Electron Velocity Vector in GSE coordinates. Calculated from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: tha_peeb_velocity_gsm
Parameter.Description: Electron Velocity Vector in GSM coordinates: Burst distribution. Calculated from burst angle distribution.
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently. This quantity will not be available before the THEMIS A(P5) efi boom deployment date: 2008-01-14/17:00:00 UT.

Parameter.Name: tha_peeb_time
Parameter.Description: tha_peeb_time, UTC, in seconds since 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00; marks center time of data sample. These are used as the sample times for the ESA burst distribution data
Parameter.Caveats: Unleaped seconds. Sample start and end time can be calculated from tha_peeb_delta_time (sample duration). Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Name: tha_peeb_delta_time
Parameter.Description: Duration in seconds of sample. In otherwords cadence of the burst distribution samples.

Parameter.Name: tha_peeb_mode
Parameter.Description: Electron survey mode, controls angle and energy binning, and time resolution, values of 0 to 8
Parameter.Caveats: Burst distribution is used to generate these quantities. It is available at high temporal(3s/1spin) resolution and high angular resolution(88 angles), but it is only available very infrequently.

Parameter.Description: EPOCH of THEMIS time base
